result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio P Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Antonio P Anderson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Antonio P Anderson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews max. penalties, elements, setting of case for prelim. State advises of plea agreement, moves to amend Count 2 to misdemeanor possession of THC. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Change of Attorney
from Defendant requesting that he be released
Defendant Antonio P Anderson in court with attorney Eric R. Heywood.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Antonio P Anderson in court, in custody. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions State on amendment of Complaint.  State advises of addition of Count 2. Court continues review of previous hearings and issuance of warrant. Court questions Defendant on failure to appear. Defendant advises that he has been homeless until June 30, made one phone call to Defense in that time, did not know about June court dates or issuance of warrant. Court questions why Defendant did not keep in contact with Defense.  Defendant advises that he did give PD a mailing address, but every time he checked there, they were unsure what they did with his mail.  State advises of new charges. Atty Crawford from PD's office is transferred into Courtroom by phone. Court will leave bond as is in this file.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 5/12/14 by Bilodeau.

Attorney Gregory A Gerbers in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is unsure why Defendant is not present, advises that Atty Maciolek tried to reach Defendant by phone, was unsuccessful.  Court reviews previous activity, issues warrant, will grant until 4:30 tomorrow to allow Defense time to find Defendant.

Attorney Eric S Maciolek in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises of filing of new complaint, requests that hearing be rescheduled.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio P Anderson in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense enters not guilty plea. Set for trial and pre-trial.
